alert.note: Alert for Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 8:21AM EST until December 19 at 3:14AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Burlington VT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Vermont... Mad River At Moretown affecting Washington County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mad River at Moretown. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, At 9 feet, the mad river begins to leave its banks. Field flooding occurs between Waitsfield and Moretown, and some local roads will flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 10.6 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 830 PM EST.
